posts.name: Martin Pirringer
posts.cooked:
Just curious why I don’t see them. This year we were discussing it but then dropped the idea as we could not get 4 omis in time. It was going to be an octagonal frame

Think I do one this off season and also with the ball drive in mind if I get that to work for my satisfaction. Do want to cut down on 3d printing times a bit and have started some tests to marry 3dp and fiberglass. But for starters I will build some test equipment… To destroy stuff under controlled circumstances.

posts.name: Mr. Siefen | 453
posts.cooked: We did last year. Made a design for this year. Gave it up for swerve. You can’t play defense or stop it with all omnis. We had an X-Drive with a drop down tank drive to get traction but with 4 propulsion motors that can’t work now. So we had to find traction+maneuvering and that’s swerve for now unless the rules change back again

posts.name: Martin Pirringer
posts.cooked: that is one reason i am working on a ball drive. would you care to share some pics?

posts.name: Martin Pirringer
posts.cooked:
Cool what did you make the frame out of and how did you do it. We 3d printed. Also how about putting breaks on the rollers of 2 of the omnis. IDK if that would count towards stearing as it is cause if you come down to it unless I am mistaken a swerve uses 8 motors 4 for drive and 4 for stear if you break 2 of the omnis then those motors/servos/solenoids are not driving the bot. Also we put the motors vertical to save space 20240126_0544361 1920×3409 468 KB

20240126_0544361 1920×3409 468 KB

20240126_0544361 1920×3409 468 KB

posts.name: Mr. Siefen | 453
posts.cooked:
I like the space savings! We tried 90° versa planetarys but didn’t like it.

We did several, some of 1 inch thick acrylic donated from a bank that closed. We would machine lots of parts out of that for several years during/after Covid. An X carve or a professional milling company have cut them in the past. Last year we also had a laser cut version produced after we cracked the acrylic version.

We also did a version full printed with the base plate printed in 4 parts and joined with resin.

Screenshot_20230314_230356_Chrome 1080×814 121 KB

Screenshot_20230314_230356_Chrome 1080×814 121 KB

Screenshot_20230314_230356_Chrome 1080×814 121 KB

As you can see here it can be very minimal and flat with falcon/krakens and the banebots sport gearboxes (16:1 is too slow!)

20230317_155919 1920×2560 585 KB 20230318_190315 1920×1440 368 KB

20230317_155919 1920×2560 585 KB

20230317_155919 1920×2560 585 KB

20230318_190315 1920×1440 368 KB

20230318_190315 1920×1440 368 KB

Before we finally committed to swerve we designed this year’s chassis to be swappable between X drive and Swerve drive. The Plus stays the same and hold the shooter/intake mechanism while the corners sections can be hot swapped.
